title: 50% Discount on Google Fi for 18 Months? Don’t Mind If I Do
description: Google Fi Wireless will give you the chance for a discount on up to four lines for a long time.
author: Ayomide Sadiq
excerpt: Google Fi Wireless will give you the chance for a discount on up to four lines for a long time.
text: Editorial Note: Talk Android may contain affiliate links on some articles. If you make a purchase through these links, we will earn a commission at no extra cost to you. Learn more. One of the nice things about shopping for a mobile carrier in the US is that there are so many options to choose from. If you don't want to go with one of the big three carriers, there are several MVNOs, smaller carriers that piggyback on the bigger carriers' infrastructure, that you can turn to instead. Google Fi Wireless is one of those MVNOs, and one major advantage that it has over the big competition is its pricing. Google Fi won't set you back by too much each month, and you can get a discount for the more lines you have. Oh, and right now, you can get an even bigger discount—50%, to be exact—due to an ongoing deal. Let's talk about it. Google Fi Will Give You 50% Off the Usual Cost of Its Standard or Essentials Plan Image: Google Fi Competition in the mobile network sector is hotter than ever, with the available subscribers left to onboard shrinking with each quarter. As a result, carriers need to figure out ways to win existing subscribers away from competitors. One good way to do that is by offering sweet deals, especially for new customers, and that's the route that Google has chosen today. If you're a new customer, you'll get the chance to subscribe to the carrier's plans at 50% of the original cost. What that means is that one line on Google Fi's Standard plan will cost you $25 a month instead of $50, and its Essentials plan drops to a super-low $17.50. Even without this deal, the more lines that you get, the bigger the discount, but the deal takes that even further. With four or more lines on Standard, you'll pay only $12.50 per line, and that drops to $11.50 with Essentials. The best part is that this deal gets locked in for 18 months, which is crazy. That's a lot of money to save over a year and a half. What Criteria Do You Need to Fulfill to Take Advantage of This Deal? Image: Google Fi Before you get too excited, you're going to have to make sure that you satisfy all the criteria that Google has put in place to take advantage of this deal. The good thing is that the list of requirements isn't that ridiculous, so let's take a look: You have to be a new customer, or a previous customer who last had service at least 180 days ago You must bring your own device You must claim the promotion before June 5th, its expiry date You must activate the line within 30 days of making the purchase You must remain on the Essentials or Standard plan for the entirety of the 18 months What Are the Differences Between the Unlimited Standard and Unlimited Essentials Plans? Image: Google If you've gotten this far, you're probably interested in what Google Fi has to offer. If that's the case, it is important to know the difference between the Unlimited Standard and Unlimited Essentials plans. Let's break it down in the table below. Unlimited EssentialsUnlimited StandardDiscounted Pricing for 1 Line$17.50$25Unlimited Data in USYesYesHigh-Speed Data Allowance30GB50GBHotspot TetheringNone25GBSmartwatch ServiceYesYesCall/Text/Data in Canada/MexicoNoYesCalls to Canada/MexicoAffordableFree Now, you should have a good idea of what Google's MVNO has to offer, and which of these deals might be better to grab onto. Through Tecno, Gionee, Vivo, Google, and now Samsung, Ayomide has always been an Android enthusiast. His current partner in crime is a Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra. You can find him playing Candy Crush or Call of Duty: Mobile, watching movies, and he is a big fan of trivia and quizzes. Previous Post
html:
Editorial Note: Talk Android may contain affiliate links on some articles. If you make a purchase through these links, we will earn a commission at no extra cost to you. Learn more.

One of the nice things about shopping for a mobile carrier in the US is that there are so many options to choose from. If you don't want to go with one of the big three carriers, there are several MVNOs, smaller carriers that piggyback on the bigger carriers' infrastructure, that you can turn to instead.

Google Fi Wireless is one of those MVNOs, and one major advantage that it has over the big competition is its pricing. Google Fi won't set you back by too much each month, and you can get a discount for the more lines you have. Oh, and right now, you can get an even bigger discount—50%, to be exact—due to an ongoing deal. Let's talk about it.

Google Fi Will Give You 50% Off the Usual Cost of Its Standard or Essentials Plan

Competition in the mobile network sector is hotter than ever, with the available subscribers left to onboard shrinking with each quarter. As a result, carriers need to figure out ways to win existing subscribers away from competitors. One good way to do that is by offering sweet deals, especially for new customers, and that's the route that Google has chosen today.

If you're a new customer, you'll get the chance to subscribe to the carrier's plans at 50% of the original cost. What that means is that one line on Google Fi's Standard plan will cost you $25 a month instead of $50, and its Essentials plan drops to a super-low $17.50.

Even without this deal, the more lines that you get, the bigger the discount, but the deal takes that even further. With four or more lines on Standard, you'll pay only $12.50 per line, and that drops to $11.50 with Essentials. The best part is that this deal gets locked in for 18 months, which is crazy. That's a lot of money to save over a year and a half.

What Criteria Do You Need to Fulfill to Take Advantage of This Deal?

Before you get too excited, you're going to have to make sure that you satisfy all the criteria that Google has put in place to take advantage of this deal. The good thing is that the list of requirements isn't that ridiculous, so let's take a look:

  • You have to be a new customer, or a previous customer who last had service at least 180 days ago
  • You must bring your own device
  • You must claim the promotion before June 5th, its expiry date
  • You must activate the line within 30 days of making the purchase
  • You must remain on the Essentials or Standard plan for the entirety of the 18 months

What Are the Differences Between the Unlimited Standard and Unlimited Essentials Plans?

If you've gotten this far, you're probably interested in what Google Fi has to offer. If that's the case, it is important to know the difference between the Unlimited Standard and Unlimited Essentials plans. Let's break it down in the table below.

Now, you should have a good idea of what Google's MVNO has to offer, and which of these deals might be better to grab onto.

Through Tecno, Gionee, Vivo, Google, and now Samsung, Ayomide has always been an Android enthusiast. His current partner in crime is a Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra. You can find him playing Candy Crush or Call of Duty: Mobile, watching movies, and he is a big fan of trivia and quizzes.
